info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRONX, NORTHERN QUEENS, AND NORTHWESTERN NASSAU COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near the Throgs Neck Bridge, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations that could be impacted include... Flushing, Mott Haven, East Tremont, Glen Cove, Garden City, Mineola, Great Neck, RFK Bridge, Throgs Neck Bridge, Laguardia Airport, Bayside, Co-op City, Elmont, Whitestone and Port Washington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
